page.title: 03Bathgate Gala Day part2
page.content: floats and uniformed organisations. Balbardie Primary School also make a decorated float. This year it was Treasure Island. Work started in February. It is all made of paper mache - this is paste and paper. The judging is held before the Procession starts. This year (1985) there were about ten floats. Also in the morning the judging of the decorated houses and premises takes place. People decorate houses and premises with spruce and paper flowers, usually an arch is erected. After the Procession, sports are held in the Meadowpark. At night people go to the fairground. There are lots of different rides and also many things to win. Late at night there is a torchlight procession which precedes a Grand Fireworks display to end the day.
